title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau - Sports Events

widgets.html:
Sports Events

Let's face it: planning a tournament, competition or exhibition shouldn't be a nail biter. So when you're considering options for your next event, talk to the pros at the Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau.

The stats for our area speak for themselves. The Peoria Area boasts a central location, on both a state and nationwide level, and is accessible via major interstates and regional airports. With over 4,500 hotel rooms, your crowds can enjoy comfortable accommodations - many near our outdoor venues for soccer, baseball and softball or the indoor venues for cheerleading, basketball or volleyball tournaments. The cities of Peoria and East Peoria each boast riverside downtowns with dining, shopping, festivals, nightlife and culture – providing plenty of options for fun once the day’s competition is done. These stats, combined with more affordable rates than most major metro markets, make Peoria a winning choice for any group.

The Peoria Area hosts major sporting events in a number of venues year-round. The NJCAA Women’s Basketball Division II National Championship, IHSA Boys State Basketball Tournament and the NSA “B” North World Series are a few of the major events that see success in the Peoria Area, year after year.  So whether it's golf, gymnastics or swimming competitions, your sporting event can truly PLAY in the Peoria Area!

title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau - Planners - Sports Events - Sports Events Testimonials

widgets.html:
Sports Events Testimonials

Will your event ‘Play in Peoria’?  Peoria has everything your group needs.  The community’s ‘can-do’ spirit, first class hotels, a recently renovated downtown, multi-purpose arena, a new riverfront museum and Caterpillar Visitors Center and various dining options all within walking distance of one another all make Peoria a winning choice for any group.  Choosing Peoria to play host to a number of our high school state final events is one of the best decisions we’ve ever made!  So will your event ‘Play in Peoria’?  It always has and it always will!

Kurt Gibson
Illinois High School Association (IHSA)
Assistant Executive Director

With our track meets completed and all of our 2015-16 activities in the book for the year, I just want to take a moment to say thanks for all of the hospitality and accommodations you give to the IESA and to me personally.  I especially want to thank you for the Weaver Ridge gift card that was waiting for me in my hotel room the first weekend of our state track meets.  What a great surprise and something I will definitely put to good use.

The Peoria CVB is a great friend and I truly appreciate all you do.  Thanks very much.

Steve Endsley
Illinois Elementary School Association
Executive Director

We have hosted the Great Lakes Valley Conference Softball Tournament at the EastSide Centre since 2004 and appreciate the opportunity to showcase our teams and student-athletes at this wonderful facility.  The community and the Peoria Area Convention and Visitor bureau have embraced our event and provide exceptional assistance to us.  Doug McCarty and his crew at the EastSide Centre do an exceptional job of hosting this championship.  It is nice to feel so welcome each spring.

Jim Naumovich
Great Lakes Valley Conference
Commissioner

Cory,

I just wanted to follow up and thank you for everything on Monday that you and Trianna did for our group.  We are excited and looking forward at trying to see if the Eastside Centre as well as Dozer Park work in to our schedule.  By far the best experience overall that I have had in terms of rolling out the red carpet for us.  It was definitely worth the trip and hopefully we will become a fixture in the area.

Thanks,

Heath Smith
JP Sports
Director of Operations

IHSA enjoys playing it’s State Finals in Peoria at the Eastside Centre. The outstanding facility is the perfect showcase for Illinois top softball teams. The support from the Peoria Area community is always welcoming, professional and first-class. Our experience in Peoria has been extraordinary.

Tracie Henry
Assistant Executive Director
Illinois High School Association

Thanks a million for your organizational skills and keeping us headed in the right direction.

Sam Knox
Assistant Executive Director
Illinois High School Association

The CVB really helps to make the golf tournament a memorable one for the participants, fans, and staff! I really appreciate all you and the CVB do for our tournament. It is always a pleasure to work with you.  And thank you for the goodies.  Always very thoughtful and much appreciated!

Sheri Strohl
Illinois Elementary School Association

I just wanted to thank you for the Minooka Indian souvenir banner from the 2015 State Cross-Country meet!  My athletic director just came down to my classroom to show me the banner and they are going to put that on display in our gym.  We greatly appreciate the time you spent on putting that together and we look forward to visiting Peoria every year! 

Kevin Gummerson
Minooka Community High School

Thank you so much for the wonderful goodies you provided to me and my staff.  The popcorn came in hand on our five and a half hour drive home Saturday, and it was super tasty!  We appreciate all that you do for HAM and the City of Peoria!  Thanks again, and see you next year!

Christina Kurapkat
JAMFest!

Thanks also for all you and Trianna do to support the GLVC Volleyball and Softball Championships.  We are very grateful for all of the help and financial assistance that is provided by the Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau.  We will continue to explore other opportunities to possibly bring future events to the Peoria area.

title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau - Media - About Us - About Our Bureau

widgets.html:
Why Destination Marketing Organizations Are Vital

According to industry expert Destinations International, communities like ours compete with every other community for a share of the world’s attention, customers, and investments. To compete effectively, we need to make people aware, create a positive impression, and encourage them to want to visit and experience our community. Attracting visitors is achieved through clearly developing and managing the community’s brand, along with a significant effort to promote, market, sell, and engage potential visitors. And all of this must be reinforced again and again. 

 

Why the PACVB is Vital

Like all Destination Marketing Organizations, the Peoria Area CVB is uniquely positioned to market our communities as desirable destinations. Our support and promotion of Greater Peoria benefits not only prospective visitors, but every resident as well. And not only that, but our expertise in destination marketing supports every organization that is conducting business, providing services, or governing a municipality. No matter the industry, sector, or field, others can benefit from our ability to position Peoria as a formidable competitor among destinations in the Midwest, North America, and the world.

 

About the PACVB

Elevator Pitch:  Discover Peoria is the region's concierge for local events, shops to visit, eateries to try, and places to explore in Greater Peoria.

Thorough Explanation: As the Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau, Discover Peoria works hand in hand with communities in our seven-county service area to create economic growth through sales and marketing of Greater Peoria’s facilities, attractions, and accommodations.
Our efforts attract sporting events, meetings and conventions, and leisure travelers. While visitors enjoy our region, their spending is bolstering our businesses and increasing our tax revenue. In addition, Discover Peoria partners with tourism and hospitality entities in our region to ensure our destination offers a wealth of opportunities to visitors, while also improving the quality of life for our residents.

title: Hispanic-Owned Businesses in Peoria IL | Shop Local

widgets.html:
Discover Hispanic-Owned Peoria

It is no secret that the Hispanic culture and business community are living and thriving in the Greater Peoria area. Peoria has been welcoming and supportive of new businesses, and Hispanic businesses are participants in the economic growth the city has experienced in recent years. The demand for Hispanic businesses has been growing and shows no signs of slowing down. As the Hispanic community increases, so do the needs they have as consumers throughout the city and, in turn, the sharing of culture through restaurants, retail and the hospitality industry with residents and travelers alike. Discover Peoria is happy to highlight Hispanic-owned businesses that have contributed to the growth of the region and continue to make a positive impact on the lives of not only the people that own them but also the people they serve. 

For more information or to recommend other businesses to include, email info@peoria.org.

title: Planning Guide

widgets.html: Planning Guide

Whether you are looking for the perfect place to have a family vacation or a fun-filled weekend with friends the Peoria region has plenty of things to do and places to see! From outdoor adventures to relaxing itineraries, we’ve got it all. 
 
Our perfect location in the Heart of Illinois allows for quick and convenient access to major metropolitan cities, including Chicago, St. Louis and Indianapolis. That convenience mixed with Midwestern friendliness and Midwester prices, let’s you explore more for less -- both stress and money. 
 
Our Meeting/Conventions and Sports Tournament planning guides will help you set the pace and our Discovery Guide will give you the inside scoop on what is trending and fun in our region.

title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau- Planners - Group Tours

widgets.html:
Group Tours

Enjoy the Peoria Area—where a unique menu of experiences awaits you! Whether you are looking for an exceptional motorcoach group tour destination or a hub and spoke location with all the amenities, we invite you to take advantage of everything we have to offer!

Plan your visit today to learn about Peoria’s famed past as one of Illinois’s top distillery towns, the architectural beauty that comprises the picturesque skyline or experience the professional side of Illinois agriculture.

Located halfway between Chicago and St. Louis, nestled along the Illinois River, the Peoria Area gives you big city amenities with small-town hospitality. From our new museum block to musical concerts on the riverfront, there are so many ways to play. Enjoy a minor league baseball game at Dozer Park or a dinner cruise on the Spirit of Peoria, an authentic paddle-wheeler. Peoria has attractions to please your entire group.

So join in the merriment of local festivals, take in a Broadway Musical, indulge yourself at a local winery or simply relax and enjoy all the Peoria Area has to offer. The choices are endless!

title: Bring Your Meeting Home
subheading: YOU can bring vital economic impact to YOUR community...

widgets.html:
Bring Your Meeting Home

YOU can bring vital economic impact to YOUR community...

By bringing your organization's conventions and events in Peoria, you’ll be helping your community to succeed. Additional spending in our area helps create new jobs, increased tax revenues and better opportunity for growth and development of the area.

In addition, if your event meets certain qualifications then $1,000 will be awarded to you or the charity of your choice.

Whether your organization needs a little help or A LOT, the Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau sales team is here to assist. 

We can assist you with:

  • Finding the Perfect Facility
  • Scoring the Best Hotel Deals
  • Setting up Site Visits & Tours
  • Creating Competitive Pricing Proposals
  • Registration Assistance
  • Housing Assistance
  • Volunteers
  • Press Release/Publicity Assistance

...and so much more!

We’re a one-stop-shop for all your meeting needs!

Peoria houses the LARGEST downstate event facility in Illinois!

The Peoria Civic Center offers:

  • 110,000 sq ft contiguous exhibit space
  • 27,000 sq ft ballroom
  • 12,000 seat arena
  • 2,200 seat theatre
  • 17,000 sq ft additional meeting space

The Peoria Area offers great accommodations with over 4,500 hotel rooms.

An array of additional meeting venues are available to suite any group!

Contact Us

Beth Reusch
Convention Sales Manager
309.282.3282
breusch@peoria.org

Quick Facts

  • 2.5 hours from Chicago and St. Louis
  • 4,500 hotel rooms
  • Peoria Riverfront Museum
  • Caterpillar Visitors Center
  • Peoria Civic Center offers over 900,000 sq. feet including all meeting rooms, exhibit hall, pre-function space and arena
  • Connected to a 402 room hotel complex by a climate- controlled skywalk
  • Peoria International Airport (PIA), offering non-stop flights to 12 destinations
  • Shopping and Dining at Shoppes at Grand Prairie, Northwoods Mall, East Court Village and The Levee District

title: Past Tournaments  & Championships

widgets.html:
Past Tournaments  & Championships

Will your event ‘Play in Peoria’?  Peoria has everything your group needs.  The community’s ‘can-do’ spirit, first class hotels, a recently renovated downtown, multi-purpose arena, a new riverfront museum and Caterpillar Visitors Center and various dining options all within walking distance of one another all make Peoria a winning choice for any group.  Choosing Peoria to play host to a number of our high school state final events is one of the best decisions we’ve ever made!  So will your event ‘Play in Peoria’?  It always has and it always will!
 
Kurt Gibson
Illinois High School Association (IHSA)
Assistant Executive Director

 
With our track meets completed and all of our 2015-16 activities in the book for the year, I just want to take a moment to say thanks for all of the hospitality and accommodations you give to the IESA and to me personally.  I especially want to thank you for the Weaver Ridge gift card that was waiting for me in my hotel room the first weekend of our state track meets.  What a great surprise and something I will definitely put to good use.
 
The Peoria CVB is a great friend and I truly appreciate all you do.  Thanks very much.
 
Steve Endsley
Illinois Elementary School Association
Executive Director


We have hosted the Great Lakes Valley Conference Softball Tournament at the EastSide Centre since 2004 and appreciate the opportunity to showcase our teams and student-athletes at this wonderful facility.  The community and the Peoria Area Convention and Visitor bureau have embraced our event and provide exceptional assistance to us.  Doug McCarty and his crew at the EastSide Centre do an exceptional job of hosting this championship.  It is nice to feel so welcome each spring.
 
Jim Naumovich
Great Lakes Valley Conference
Commissioner

title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau - Privacy Policy

widgets.html:
Privacy Policy

Information gathered will be used by the Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau (PACVB) and may be shared with our Members. The PACVB recognizes the importance of protecting the privacy of all information provided by users of peoria.org. We created the following policy guidelines with a fundamental respect for our users' right to privacy to guide our relationships with our users.

Information Collected by the PACVB
The PACVB collects information about users during their registration, their inquiries, their participation in certain activities on our web site, including contests and polls; and through the use of cookies. When users request pages from our server, our web server automatically collects some information about the users, including their IP addresses. These addresses are used by computers on the network to send the requested pages to users.

Information will not be sold or distributed to outside third parties. The PACVB will not reveal any personal information that users provide to us to any third party without their permission, the PACVB utilizes users' IP addresses to help diagnose problems with our server and to administer our web site. We also use it to gather broad demographic information about our users in general. This information does not contain anything that can identify users personally.

Using e-mail addresses provided at registration or otherwise, the PACVB periodically sends out promotional e-mails to our users about services offered by the PACVB. Users can indicate that they do not wish to receive e-mail information from the Peoria Area CVB. Third parties will not contact our users through the use of our e-mail lists.

Our site uses cookies to deliver content specific to users' interests and to honor their preferences. This information is used to assist us in creating a site that will serve the needs of our users.

Upon request, the PACVB will remove users (and their information) from our database or permit them to "opt-out" of any further e-mail or contact.

General
The PACVB is not responsible for the content or the privacy polices of web sites to which it may provide links or the web sites of its advertisers or Members.

The PACVB uses reasonable precautions to keep the personal information disclosed to us secure and to disclose such information only to responsible third parties after permission from the user.

If you have any questions about this privacy statement, the practices of this site or your dealings with the PACVB, please feel free to contact us.

widgets.html:
Sports Event Facilities

Our Peoria Area is quickly becoming a mecca for sporting events.  With a number of state of the art facilities, we can host any type of event of any size, making it one of the top sports destinations in the country.

It isn’t just prime facilities that make us a major draw for sporting events.  The city is also a destination spot for families. There is an endless number of attractions, dining and events that give families something to do between games.  Nearly 4,000 hotel rooms are within short driving distance to any facility.  We are a sports destination for athletes, but it is also a vacation destination for their families.

title: Meetings in Peoria, IL | Convention Venues & Facilities

widgets.html:
Meetings and Conventions

If a central location with affordable venues and accommodations sounds appealing for your next meeting or convention, you’ll want to talk with us!

Located in the heart of Illinois and the Midwest, the Peoria Area is just a short drive from Chicago, Indianapolis and St. Louis and is accessible via major interstates.  If you’re traveling from further away, our international airport offers non-stop flights from 11 destinations, along with cabs, car rentals, and shuttle service to your final destination.

The Peoria Area offers great accommodations as well, with over 4,500 hotel rooms to choose from – many of them newly renovated and within walking distance of the largest downstate event facility in Illinois. The cities of Peoria and East Peoria each boast riverside downtowns with dining, shopping, festivals, nightlife and culture – providing plenty of options for fun once the day’s business is done.

Host a convention that gives your attendees the quality experience they are expecting - at a more affordable rate than major metro markets. Bring your next meeting to the Peoria Area!

title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau - Meetings and Conventions - Meeting Testimonials

widgets.html:
Meeting Testimonials

"The success of our 2019 Collie Club of America National Specialty Dog Show cannot be talked about without mentioning the contributions of our real Hosts; the City of Peoria, the Peoria Civic Center, the Marriott Pere Marquette & the Courtyard by Marriott, and the Peoria Area Convention & Visitors Bureau. They were all an absolute joy to work with! They took our "Collie Invasion" in stride and worked with us every step of the way to accommodate our every need."

Jean Framke
Collie Club of America
Show Co-Chair

 

"Holding the Illinois Music Education Conference in Peoria has worked for ILMEA for over 30 years due, in no small part, to the amazing work of the Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau!  No question or concern has been too great or too small, and the staff is always available to assist us with creative and workable solutions.  ILMEA could not produce our event without the Peoria CVB!"

Darcy A. Nendza, CMP
Illinois Music Education Association
Executive Director

 

 

“Our group recently needed the assistance of the PACVB while prepping our bid to host the 2019 Collie Club of America National Specialty Dog Show at the Peoria Civic Center. We were amazed when they outlined all aspects of what they could do for us.

The PACVB provided us with an array of needed information on the Peoria area, proposals from area hotels, airport information, and they worked closely with the PCC to apply for and secure funding for our group. Additionally, as we were short on time at that point, did so in an extremely timely and courteous manner! They then went above and beyond, in our opinion, by compiling all the info into an exceptional “Packet” that they allowed us to customize by including any other documents we desired. The end result of their hard work gave us an outstanding, professional addition to our bid.  They were so easy to work with and BOY! did they make us look good!  We needed to beat out a competing bid by impressing 52 Board members!

I believe part of our amazement at the service we received was due to our strained dealing with another venue in the Chicago/Northern Illinois area and total lack of assistance from their CVB.  WOW what a difference! Laura, Cory & Kim at the PACVB made us feel welcome from the very start!  And when we came down for a visit we were further impressed by their hospitality! We not only toured the PCC and Marriott hotels, but Laura & Kim surprised us and drove us around town too!  We could ask them anything and received friendly, prompt, detailed, if we don’t know – we’ll find out, “we are in this together” responses!  Their seamless relationship with the PCC was also refreshing. We absolutely know they have our backs and with their help we know we can and will make our event ‘One of a Kind’!!”  

Jean Franke and Kelly Montgomery
2019 Host Co-Chairs
Collie Club of America

 

"On behalf of the College of Medicine, we would like to thank you for the gift baskets you guys provided us! We had a successful event with over 50 students and about 30 doctors, including a large group who took a bus from Rockford! The prizes were a great added touch that I think shows Peoria rolls out the red carpet to welcome our guests as well as to those students we hope to keep here as they train and eventually practice medicine. Again, thank you for your contributions!"

Dave Haney
Director of Strategic Communications
University of Illinois College of Medicine at Peoria

 

"Thank you Peoria Civic Center, Savor & PACVB! 

I appreciate your time and willingness to work to improve and address the few issues we discussed yesterday.

I have worked with only a few cities in my 20 years of Association event planning and want you all to know that you are serious when it comes to client service, event detailing, focus on success and making us look good to our members.  You all have a high score in my mind and I greatly value your individual roles with the IAFPD Conference!

Kudos to each one of you!"

Cheri Breneman
Illinois Association of Fire Protection Districts
Association Administrator

 

"Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau, Thank you for hosting such a wonderful and successful international conference. The quality and diversity of speakers was excellent, the lunches and social events provided outstanding food and atmosphere for conference members to interact and network. It was a pleasure attending a conference in community that cares about the Illinois River and its resources."

Matt O'Hara
IDNR-Fisheries
Aquatic Nuisance Species and Aquaculture Program
Natural Resources Advanced Specialist
Asian Carp Project Leader

 

"By all accounts and feedbacks, the Midwest Pediatric Cardiology Society and Midwest Sonographer Conferences were overwhelmingly successful.   Many have said this is the best Midwest conference in over 10 years!   When projects like these go well, it is always a TEAM effort.  I want to thank all of you for the hard work and the extra hours to make these events memorable for all who attended. I personally am so very grateful.  I feel truly honored to be associated with all of you."

David Chan, M.D.
Division Head
OSF Saint Francis Pediatric Cardiology

 

“I would like to thank you and your staff – Joni Staley, Cory Hatfield and Kim McKune, for their outstanding attention provided to the Illinois Association of Public Procurement Officials and the 2016 Spring Training and Suppliers Expo. Our group will be booking the same venue for the 2017 Spring Training! Thank you again.”

Jim Smith
IAPPO President

title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau - Partners

widgets.html:
Partners

The Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau (PACVB) is the Peoria Area’s official destination marketing organization representing seven central Illinois Counties (Peoria, Tazewell, Woodford, Fulton, Mason, Marshall and Stark). The PACVB serves as a primary visitor resource by promoting our members’ restaurants, attractions, shops, accommodations, services and local events. We encourage visitors to spend time and resources in and around the Peoria Area.

Across the country, Convention and Visitors Bureaus (CVB’s) have earned the respect and trust of visitors and we take great pride in promoting and marketing the Peoria Area.

title: Peoria Civic Center

widgets.html:
Peoria Civic Center

The Peoria Civic Center is a multipurpose event facility offering the highest levels of customer service for clients and patrons. The Peoria Civic Center includes an arena with seating for 11,300, a 2,196-seat theater, 45,000 square feet of meeting space and 110,000 square feet of exhibit hall space. The downtown location is less than 10 minutes from the Peoria International Airport with over 4,000 hotel rooms nearby, 1,000 within walking distance and 400 attached via indoor skywalk.

title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau - Planners - Meetings and Conventions - Meeting Planning Services

widgets.html:
Services

Our skilled sales and servicing team is ready to help make your meeting, convention, sports tournament or special event a success! From finding the perfect venue to creating a local marketing blitz to finding a thoughtful thank you gift for your volunteers, we can do it all. With more than 40 years of experience in event planning throughout the Peoria region the Discover Peoria team is here to help you!

Services include but are not limited to::

  • Assistance with venue selection, housing and financial support
  • Provide publicity on our website/produce custom written press releases
  • Assist with speakers, places to visit and special events
  • Offer PACVB welcome bags and information booth or Mobile Visitors Center at your event
  • Recruit local volunteers according to event needs
  • Additional event planning and management as requested
  • Set up local dignitary or PACVB staff member welcome
  • Assist with post event wrap-up, tracking and impact

title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau - Planners - Meetings and Conventions - Meeting Venues and Facilities
subheading: Top Places to Meet in Peoria

widgets.html:
Meeting Venues and Facilities

The Peoria Area boasts world-class convention and expo centers, featuring the Peoria Civic Center-located in downtown Peoria and the largest of its kind in downstate Illinois. We are also hosts to numerous convention hotels and 4,000+ guest rooms.

Top Places to Meet in Peoria

Whether you're planning a meeting or a convention for 100 or 10,000 people, consider holding your event in Peoria, Illinois. The centrally located Midwest city, easily accessible via several major interstates, is home to Illinois' largest downstate event facility, Peoria Civic Center. Combined with 4,000 hotel rooms and the helpful staff at The Peoria Area CVB, see why Peoria Civic Center is perfectly poised to host your next event.

The Meetings Centerpiece of Peoria

Peoria Civic Center is Central Illinois' premier meeting facility, encompassing an arena, a theater and a convention center. Inside the convention center, find a 27,000-square-foot carpeted ballroom with 25-foot ceilings, an outdoor balcony with panoramic views of downtown Peoria and its own green room. The ballroom can accommodate up to 1,600 guests for a sit-down meal or break into nine individual meeting spaces.

Also available are 16 meeting rooms, which range in size from 500 to 7,300 square feet. With state-of-the-art audiovisual equipment available on-site—as well as a dedicated audiovisual specialist—each room can be set to accommodate your needs, from classroom-style seating to banquet setups.

For exhibits, the Peoria Civic Center has 110,000 square feet of contiguous exhibit space that can be divided into four separate halls, three of which are column free. Thirty-foot ceilings accommodate large equipment.

The beautiful on-site Theater has a capacity of 2,173 and can be used for performances and concerts, as well as lectures and keynote sessions. To kick off your conference on a high note, consider setting up registration in the 7,000-square-foot Theater Lobby, which has beautiful ceiling artwork, a glass elevator and a spiral staircase, as well as built-in coat check and a bar.

Often used to host concerts like Eric Church and REO Speedwagon, the 12,000-seat arena at the civic center does double duty as a trade show space. It can easily accommodate 140 spaces on its 27,400-square-foot floor, as well as 70 additional booths on the outer concourse.

Winters in Illinois can be brutal, but cold-month meetings at Peoria Convention Center are painless, thanks to a climate-controlled skywalk that provides direct access to 400 nearby hotel rooms. Ask about free meeting space and more perks available to groups that meet appropriate qualifications.

Hotel Meeting Spaces

Combining historic elegance with modern conveniences, the AAA Four Diamond, 286-room Peoria Marriott Pere Marquette Hotel is located in downtown Peoria and connected to Peoria Civic Center via skywalk. The hotel encompasses 18,900 square feet square feet of meeting space across multiple rooms, with the largest measuring 7,500 square feet. If you need an additional room block but don't want to split up your group, the attached Courtyard Peoria Downtown is an easy, convenient option. 

In the heart of downtown Peoria, you will also find the newly remodeled 4 Points by Sheraton that boasts 323 guest rooms along with 12 meeting spaces that are perfect for receptions or conferences, and the largest ballroom can easily serve up to 1,800 people.

The Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Grand Prairie is one of our areas newest hotels. With its convenient accessibility, located just minutes away from the Peoria Civic Center and seconds from the Shoppes at Grand Prairie,its amazing onsite restaurant, Suite Fire Grill, and with a welcoming sales staff and a venue with all the amenities you could ask for, the Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites is a perfect choice for a meeting planner!

Waterfront Off-Site Venues

If your meeting is headquartered at Peoria Civic Center, you may want to consider an off-site event to give attendees a change of scenery. An affordable, convenient and elegant option is The Gateway Building, located along the Peoria Riverfront. Within walking distance of hotels and numerous restaurants, the venue is only a block from Interstate 74. One of Gateway's meeting spaces, Room 201, has 1,350 square feet of social space to accommodate up to 120 people banquet style.

Convention-goers can take in views of the Illinois River at Peoria Riverfront Museum, which includes several flexible meeting spaces. Host a reception in the lobby, plan a lecture in the auditorium that over looks a beautiful sculpture garden, or make presentations in the 200-seat Giant Screen Theater.

For a truly memorable event, gather your convention attendees in the museum's Dome Planetarium, which hosts incredible laser shows, with private shows available for groups.

More Unique Spaces

Located at The MAXAM Building in downtown Peoria, The Waterhouse Banquet & Catering Facility has three options for meetings: The Distillery Room, which has exposed brick walls and hardwood floors; The Ballroom, an elegant space with indoor balconies and beautiful views of the river; and Broadway Lounge, a multilevel entertainment space that also plays home to Dueling Pianos some weekends.

Another popular meetings facility in Peoria, the Caterpillar Visitors Center features a variety of room sizes for half- or full-day rental. The dining room can seat 104 guests; the classroom hosts up to 50; the smaller conference room holds 16 for board meetings; and the 797 Theater holds about 60.

Peoria, Illinois, offers premium meeting and convention venues for every style and size amid a multifaceted, bustling urban core. Download our meeting planner guide to choose the perfect venue for your next professional.

title: Reunions

widgets.html:
Reunions

Family reunions, class reunions, or reunions with your long-time friends, are always special occasions that will be filled with memory-making and laughter. What Peoria specializes in is providing the perfect location and experience to make your reunion the best one yet. 
 
From outdoor activities and destinations such as Wildlife Prairie Park, the Peoria Zoo or the Luthy Botanical Gardens, to indoor mainstays like the Pere Marquette Ballrooms or the specialty venues like Venue Chisca, we’ve got the perfect spot in store. 
 
Looking for something a little different, maybe host your reunion at a Peoria Chiefs baseball game or a Peoria Rivermen Hockey match? Take it to the river and hop aboard the Spirit of Peoria paddle boat cruise. Take in some golf at one of our many highly regarded golf courses such as Metamora Fields, or see what is new at the Ivy Club.
 
For more information or help planning your reunion, please contact us a info@peoria.org.

title: Peoria Area Convention and Visitors Bureau - Blog - 10 Peoria Activities Before or After a Meeting
subheading: 10 Peoria Activities Before or After a Meeting

widgets.html:
Activity Ideas

10 Peoria Activities Before or After a Meeting

You’ve planned a jam-packed meeting or convention in Peoria, Illinois, because of its terrific central location, the multi-faceted Peoria Civic Center and other meeting facilities. But what entertainment and activities will your attendees find here, before or after a meeting? Check out tasty restaurant fare, local sports events, and arts or historical outposts. Here are 10 great ways for meeting attendees to enjoy their free time in Peoria.

1) Travel the Illinois River

Whether you join a public trip or book The Spirit of Peoria for a private event, an Illinois River cruise will provide a memorable experience for everyone. Ninety-minute public sightseeing trips begin and end at Peoria’s riverfront dock, and themed cruises are also available (check the website for details). Better yet, schedule one of your convention functions on this magnificent old-school paddlewheel boat.

2) Explore the World

Visitors to the nonprofit Peoria Riverfront Museum can see permanent collections, plus rotating exhibitions and programs, that connect art and science with history and human achievement. The magnificent Dome Planetarium provides real-time trips through the Universe, or you can see a movie in the giant screen theater, which has a 52-by-70-foot screen. This year’s rotating exhibits address genomes and ways in which science and physics create light. The museum can also host meetings and conventions and features beautiful riverfront views too.

3) Learn About A Legendary Corporation

At Caterpillar Visitors Center, visitors get a crash course about the machinery and people who have made Caterpillar a worldwide brand since it began in the 1800s. A leading manufacturer of construction and mining equipment, as well as diesel- and natural gas-powered engines, the company is known for its industrial gas turbines and diesel-electric locomotives.

4) Tour Peoria On Two Wheels

World on Wheels Segway Tours provides a fun and unusual way to ride along the Peoria RiverFront while learning about this area’s history and present-day character. Riding a Segway for the first time requires only brief instruction and practice. You’ll be gliding your way through Peoria before you know it while socializing with other riders. Choose from 30-minute, one-hour or two-hour tours.

5) View Beautiful Sculptures

Enjoy the outdoors and creativity of artists during free guided Sculpture Walk tours, held on Saturdays through October, or book a private tour for your group. Beginning at the Peoria Riverfront Museum, each year-long show incorporates massive pieces crafted from wood and various metals by individual sculptors and displayed throughout Peoria’s Warehouse District.

6) Attend a Minor League Ball Game

Looking for some seasonal fun outdoors? Spend a pleasant evening or weekend afternoon watching Minor League Peoria Chiefs Baseball at Dozer Park. This Single-A affiliate of the St. Louis Cardinals plays in a state-of-the-art ball park, located within walking distance of downtown Peoria and minutes from several downtown hotels. You can also schedule a private meeting or event here.

7) See Professional Ice Action

From October through April, Peoria Civic Center is home to fast-paced sports action, thanks to the Peoria Rivermen Hockey Club. The club plays games against teams that come from as close as Evansville, Indiana, and Columbus, Ohio, or as far away as Mississippi and Pensacola, Florida.

8) Eat and Drink Along the RiverFront

Take one converted railroad depot, serve house-smoked barbecue and fresh tacos paired with craft beers and cocktails, and you have Blue Duck Barbecue Tavern. The popular watering hole flanks Peoria’s RiverFront and showcases pours from regional microbreweries, as well as high-quality 

wines and whiskeys. Listed on the National Register of Historic Places, the restaurant features a 13-foot ceiling and reclaimed barn wood, alongside intriguing artwork and multiple large-screen TVs.

9) Dine Near Peoria Civic Center

Operating since 1960 and located less than five miles from Peoria Civic Center, Jim’s Downtown Steakhouse is part Old English Country Inn, part pub. You’ll experience an old-school ambience and menu, from tangy shrimp dijon and avocado bruschetta appetizers to fork-tender filet mignon and jumbo sea scallops as entrees. A robust wine and cocktail menu complements live piano music, which begins nightly at 8:00 p.m.

Kickback on Fulton is a relaxed neighborhood bar and lounge not far from the Civic Center. Devour pizza and beer while you take in the latest games, broadcast on large TVs. Its expansive patio is a prime spot to perch during warm weather.

A quick walk from Peoria Civic Center is a lovingly restored 1889 stone church now known as Obed and Isaac’s Microbrewery & Eatery. Fill up on reubens, veggie burgers or bacon-wrapped dates, then unwind over a game of bocce ball or bags outside.

10) Savor Peoria’s Warehouse District and Beyond

For a casual lunch, dinner or late-night snack beyond your meeting site, Sugar Wood-Fired Bistro crafts inventive wood-fired pizzas, such as smokey pork chipotle or pesto arugula. If you’re not in the mood for pizza, the menu also includes hefty sandwiches plus meal-sized salads and handcrafted sweet treats too, at this cozy, rustic restaurant.

Warehouse District gastropub Thyme Kitchen + Craft Beer combines an extensive bar menu with shareable appetizers, hefty sandwiches and burgers, plus soup or entrée salads and decadent desserts. For something different, try the deconstructed duck tamales or vegetarian stir fry.

Thirty-thirty Coffee Co. is a locally owned morning favorite whose employees are deeply passionate about java. A farm-to-cup mentality translates into coffee varietals from across the globe, served at small or communal tables. There’s also free Wi-Fi available.

Elsewhere in town, grab a latte at Zion Coffee Bar or a beer at Rhodell Brewery. Combine craft brews with games at 8-Bit Beercade and late-night burgers at Richard’s On Main, too.

When meeting attendees have a free time before or after the event, this city offers plenty of enticing options. Plan your visit at www.peoria.org.

title: Groups

slides.title: The exterior of Hotel Pere Marquette in downtown Peoria lit up at night

widgets.html:
Group Hotels

No matter if you need lodging for a bachelorette party, wedding, sports team or business meeting, many of the hotels in the Peoria area offer group accommodations to satisfy all members of your party.

Consider Peoria Marriott Pere Marquette if you’re looking for a sophisticated and elegant stay with an on-site restaurant and luxurious amenities. Embassy Suites by Hilton is a relaxed all-suite hotel with a indoor pool, cafe, restaurant and conference center that offers group booking.

Stay at Holiday Inn Express and Suites for laid back rooms, an indoor pool, a gym, and free breakfast. Mark Twain Hotel is a boutique style hotel and another option for groups with free airport transportation and an onsite restaurant.

If you’re seeking a comfortable and satisfactory stay for a large group, central Illinois will not let you down!
